item.title: WordPress 7.0 Beta 2
item.description:
WordPress 7.0 Beta 2 is here!

Test the latest beta version of WordPress on a test server and site.

  • Latest Beta Version: WordPress 7.0 Beta 2 is now ready for testing.
  • Development Status: This beta version of the WordPress software is under development.
  • Testing Warning: Please do not install, run, or test this version of WordPress on production or mission-critical websites.

item.title: New AI Agent Skill for WordPress
item.description:
Did you knowâ€¦ ðŸ¤“

â€¦there is a new WordPress AI agent skill called wp-playground to speed up testing for plugins and themes?

It runs WordPress through the Playground CLI, detects whether your code belongs in wp-content/plugins or wp-content/themes, and helps agents validate changes in a fast feedback loop.

Early testing showed startup time dropping from about a minute to a few seconds with helper scripts, making iteration much faster.

item.title: Learn WordPress for Designers
item.description:
Did you knowâ€¦ ðŸ¤“

â€¦Learn WordPress has a dedicated learning path especially for designers?

It gently guides you through blocks, patterns, and the Site Editor, helping you turn creative ideas into real WordPress websites step by step.

item.title: WordPress and the future of AI
item.description:
Did you knowâ€¦ ðŸ¤“

â€¦artificial intelligence is becoming a foundational topic within the WordPress project?

New APIs and standards are being developed to allow AI tools to interact with WordPress in a structured, predictable, and responsible way.

item.title: WordPress isnâ€™t just software
item.description:
Did you knowâ€¦ ðŸ¤“

â€¦there are large WordPress events around the world where enthusiasts meet and learn from each other?

Conferences like WordCamp Europe, WordCamp US, and WordCamp Asia bring the global WordPress community together in person.

These events feature talks, workshops, and networking opportunities for everyone from beginners to seasoned developers.

item.title: WordPress powers the open web
item.description:
Did you knowâ€¦ ðŸ¤“

â€¦WordPress now powers more than 43% of all websites worldwide, making it the most widely used content management system on the internet?

This scale is the result of nearly two decades of open-source development and a global community continuously improving the platform.
